title: Police arrest four in Winslow motor vehicle burglary spree updated
content: Anthony Carpenter of Winslow, Dylan Copeland of Waterville, Hayley Cooley of Lewiston and Molly Roy of Winslow face charges in a string of car burglaries. (Winslow Police)      WINSLOW (WGME) -- Four people face charges after a police investigation into numerous motor vehicle burglaries in Winslow.    Winslow Police said between April 25 and May 5 eight motor vehicles at six different addresses around town were broken into, with items stolen from each vehicle.    Every burglary happened to an unlocked vehicle and the burglaries took place late at night, police said.    Items stolen, included GPS units, credit and debit cards, cash and other personal items. But use of the credit and debit cards at local businesses around Maine and online provided a big boost to the investigation.    Police viewed surveillance footage from local businesses to identify a suspect, leading to the discover of more suspects.    A search warrant executed at a Winslow resident on May 6 led police to find evidence, leading to interviews and arrests of four people.    Facing charges are Anthony Carpenter, 21 , of Winslow for two couts each of theft by receiving stolen property, misuse of identification and theft; Hayley Cooley, 18, of Waterville for three counts each of misuse of identification and theft and one count of theft by receiving stolen property, criminal conspiracy and illegal transportation of alcohol by a minor, Dylan Copeland, 19 of Waterville for four counts of burglary of a motor vehicle and theft and one count of criminal mischief and possession of alcohol by a minor, and Molly Roy, 18, of Winslow for three counts of theft, two counts of misuse of identification and one count of burglary of a motor vehicle.    The four suspects posted bail and have been released. Their first court date will by July 3.    Winslow Police have seized stolen items from vehicles where the owners have yet to be identified. Anyone who believes they were victimized in this burglary spree is asked to contact Officer Christiansen at (207) 872-5215.    Police also reminded the public to keep their vehicles locked while parked in their driveways.
